qas.question: What is the North Carolina Museum of Art near?
What type of art is in the Museum of Art?

answers.text: American Art, European Art and ancient art,

qas.question: When was the Auguste Rodine exhibit?
How many people attended the Monet exhibit?
How did the museum get the artworks they have?
What is the North Carolina Museum of Art far away from?
How many people attended the da Vinci exhibit?
What architect from Missouri completed the museum?

context: North Carolina Museum of Art, occupying a large suburban campus on Blue Ridge Road near the <a0_0><b5_0>North Carolina State Fairgrounds<b5_0/><a0_0/>, maintains one of the premier public art collections located between Washington, D.C., and Atlanta. In addition to its extensive collections of <a1_0>American Art, European Art and ancient art,<a1_0/> the museum recently has hosted major exhibitions featuring <b6_0>Auguste Rodin<b6_0/> (in <a2_0>2000<a2_0/>) and Claude Monet (in 2006-07), each attracting more than <a3_0><b7_0>200,000<b7_0/><a3_0/> visitors. Unlike most prominent public museums, the North Carolina Museum of Art acquired a large number of the works in its permanent collection through purchases with <a4_0>public funds<a4_0/>. The museum's outdoor park is one of the largest such art parks in the country. The museum facility underwent a major expansion which greatly expanded the exhibit space that was completed in <b8_0>2010<b8_0/>. The 127,000 sf new expansion is designed by NYC architect <b9_0>Thomas Phifer<b9_0/> and Partners.
